Description: This template deploys Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) instances in an autoscale group behind an ELB, and joins them to a domain.

Ec2SecurityGroupId.Description: Security Group ID for RDSH EC2 instances

ElbSecurityGroupId.Description: Security Group ID for the RDSH Elastic Load Balancer

LoadBalancerName.Description: Name of the Elastic Load Balancer

AmiId.Description: (Optional) AMI ID -- will supersede Lambda-based AMI lookup using AmiNameSearchString

AmiNameSearchString.Description: Search pattern to match against an AMI Name

CloudWatchAgentUrl.Description: (Optional) S3 URL to CloudWatch Agent installer. Example: s3://amazoncloudwatch-agent/windows/amd64/latest/AmazonCloudWatchAgent.zip

ConnectionBrokerFqdn.Description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the primary Connection Broker, e.g. "cb.example.com"

DesiredCapacity.Description: The number of instances the autoscale group will spin up initially

DomainAccessUserGroup.Description: Domain group of users authorized to use the RDSH

DomainDirectoryId.Description: ID of the AWS Directory Service domain, e.g. d-xxxxxxxxxx

DomainDnsName.Description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the forest root domain e.g. example.com

DomainNetbiosName.Description: Netbios name of the domain (e.g. EXAMPLE)

DomainSvcAccount.Description: User name for the account that will join the instance to the Connection Broker Cluster

DomainSvcPassword.Description: Password for the Connection Broker service account. Must be at least 8 characters containing letters, numbers and symbols

ExtraSecurityGroupIds.Description: List of extra Security Group IDs to attach to the RDSH instances -- include _at least_ the SG allowing connectivity to the Connection Broker database

ForceUpdateToggle.Description: A/B toggle that forces a change to a LaunchConfig property, triggering the AutoScale Update Policy

InstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the Remote Desktop Session Instance

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

LdapContainerOU.Description: DN of the LDAP container or OU in which the RDSH instance will be placed

MaxCapacity.Description: The maximum number of instances for the autoscale group

MinCapacity.Description: The minimum number of instances for the autoscale group

RdpPrivateKeyPassword.Description: Password to the RDP certificate private key

RdpPrivateKeyPfx.Description: S3 bucket and path to a private key for the RDP certificate, e.g. "<bucket>/path/to/key.pfx"

RdpPrivateKeyS3Endpoint.Description: S3 endpoint URL hosting the bucket where the RDP certificate private key is stored

ScaleDownDesiredCapacity.Description: (Optional) Desired number of instances during the Scale Down Scheduled Action; ignored if ScaleDownSchedule is unset

ScaleDownSchedule.Description: (Optional) Scheduled Action in cron-format (UTC) to scale down the number of instances; ignored if empty or ScaleUpSchedule is unset (E.g. "0 0 * * *")

ScaleUpSchedule.Description: (Optional) Scheduled Action in cron-format (UTC) to scale up to the Desired Capacity; ignored if empty or ScaleDownSchedule is unset (E.g. "0 10 * * Mon-Fri")

SubnetIDs.Description: List of Subnet IDs where the RDSH instances and ELB we be launched

UpdateSchedule.ConstraintDescription: Must be in CloudWatch events schedule expression format (Cron or Rate).
UpdateSchedule.Description: (Optional) Time interval between auto stack updates. Refer to the AWS documentation for valid input syntax: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/events/ScheduledEvents.html

UserProfileDiskPath.Description: Path to a CIFS share where User Profile Disks are stored, e.g. "\\home.example.com\Profiles$"

Properties.GroupDescription: Allow Remote Access to the RDSH instances
Allow connectivity through the RDSH ELB to RDSH instances

Fn::Join: Write-Verbose 'Waiting for SSM to complete domain join, which reboots the instance automatically' -Verbose
